title: Reflection - wide beam of light and rough surface

content.question: A wide beam of light is incident on a rough surface, as shown in the figure, where the width of the beam is represented as multiple light rays. If the rough surface exhibits diffuse reflection, which of the following best represents the beam of light after it has interacted with the surface?

choices.label: The figure shows a vertical surface with the rough side facing left. Five rays of light are traveling down and to the right, away from the other side of the rough surface.
The figure shows a vertical surface with the rough surface facing left. Five rays of light are traveling down and to the left, away from a rough surface.
The figure shows a vertical surface with the rough surface facing left. Five rays of light are traveling up and to the left, away from a rough surface.

The figure shows a vertical surface with the rough surface facing left. Five rays of light are traveling away from a rough surface to the left in different directions. Three rays move up and to the left and two rays move down and to the left in non parallel trajectories.

content.answer: The figure shows a vertical surface with the rough surface facing left. Five rays of light are traveling away from a rough surface to the left in different directions. Three rays move up and to the left and two rays move down and to the left in non parallel trajectories.
